solution: As shown by the graph, there are $3$ values of $x$ for which $f(x) = 3$: when $x = -3$, $1$, or $5$. If $f(f(x)) = 3$, it follows then that $f(x) = -3, 1, 5$. There are no values of $x$ such that $f(x) = -3$. There is exactly one value of $x$ such that $f(x) = 1$ and $5$, namely $x = -1$ and $3$, respectively. Thus, there are $\boxed{2}$ possible values of $x$.
